Text: Hardsub is printed into the movie (etc cant be removed) while softsub uses a external subtitle file, like .srt or .sub.
Uhmmm...how can it be softsubbed if it has only one FILE!!!!!
Nevermind...I couldn't see mkv because of the damn side banner---->
ah c'mon a seed shud be nice
MKV is a "container" format, meaning it can contain multiple files inside it.  For example, codecs, video, audio, and subtitle files ;)  That's what it was designed for
